document.full_text: fisherman steven smith-borlah gazes out to sea from his beachside hut in akwidae, a coconut leaf-roofed village that squats between a mangrove swamp and the overgrown ruins of a 17th century german fort.
document.title: in ghana, not all see oil as a blessing
